page.title: 14Barham During World War 2
page.content: Early one morning a Dornier 17Z German aircraft crashed on to the old railway bridge about 100 metres from the village school.Recently a local resident found a piece of the wreckage embedded in a tree and was able to recover it.A large bomb exploded near the church leaving a 2 metre crater but no houses were destroyed.Children from Rochester and Gillingham were evacuated to Barham. School hours were divided amongst the groups.But as it proved to be dangerous here,the children soon returned home.Some families had their own bomb shelter while others shared.They sometimes invited soldiers who were camping out nearby in for a meal .The village hall was used as a canteen for the soldiers.The R.A.F were stationed at the nursing home;fighters were repaired in a hangar behind the house.
